title: Grading form for Master's Project presentation
instructions:
Mark the student on their ability to effectively communicate their work to an audience, not on the content per se as this has already been assessed in their report marks. In each category below indicate a broad grade class and then use these as a guid to indicate an overall grade. For guidance:
  • Fail (F): <50%
  • Pass (P): 50-59%
  • Low Merit (LM): 60-64%
  • High Merit (HM): 65-69%
  • Low Distinction (LD): 70 -85%
  • High Distinction (HD): 85-100%

components.label: Preparation
components.info:
Disorganised & confusing
Evidence of careful preparation of material

components.label: Message
components.info:
Unclear what is being tested & what are the conclusions
Objectives, hypotheses & take-home message clearly given

components.label: Understandable
components.info:
Does not explain complex terms and loses audience
Clear to a lay audience

components.label: Structure
components.info:
Unclear how each slide is linked to the next slide(s)
Logical flow & slide order, & good story

components.label: Voice and body language
components.info:
Does not engage with the audience, tentative & hard-to-hear
Clearly articulated, faces the audience & confidently presented

components.label: Presentation
components.info:
Too much info. per slide, cluttered & confusing
Good balance of text, figures & animation to tell story. Concise & uncluttered
